column4: How do I tell whether my Hardy Heron version is 8.04 or 8.04.1?
How do I tell whether my Hardy Heron version is 8.04 or 8.04.1?
I tried to look it up using System Monitor, but it shows 8.04.   Is this sufficient, or is there a terminal version that tells you the precise release number?
Hmmm, it only shows 8.04, not the latest 8.04.1
do you have auto update set
what you could do is open system.admin.update manager click on check if it shows no updates
you should have been auto updated to 8.04.1 then been sending updates this month like chickens with hjeads cut off lol
they also released a iso of 8.04.1 on distrowatch.com

I always update it as and when it becomes available.  THing is that when I look up System Monitor, it shows 8.04, and my email from Ubuntu says the latest is 8.04.1, which is why I was puzzled.  But I am glad that ariel has solved my question.
I agree, but why download 700Mb, when I can get it upgraded via Synaptic Manager>?
was just telling in case ya didnt know i'm slow lol
lol, no worries, thanks for the help.
i tried out the 8.10 it's a mess lol
It's supposed to be released in October

Okay, but I wouldn't try 8.10 as it'd be highly experimental at this stage.  Granted that it does have the stability of 8.04, but some experimental system programs or the like in this 8.10 version aren't fully tested, hence the term "development".
